review_blob: You have to have a palate for mass produced light beer to enjoy this.  Believe it or not, this is my regular brew along with Miller Lite.  But SHHHHHH!  Dont tell anybody.  :-)
This is one of the more hoppy lagers of the mass-brewed beers.  I like it!

Ratings based on beer from the tap.  Nothing beats Weiss beer on tap! 

Thats the only way I really like Weiss beer.

Im a bit partial toward cream ales and this is an old favorite of mine.

Another old favorite that I havent had in ages  is Red Cap Cream Ale.

This is one of Schmohz "high test" ales; 10% ABV.  Its a favorite for growler fills to take home.  

The only shortcoming I notice is that Hopcknocker is a bit sweet on the pallet.  Its not objectionable by any means.  I certainly like it, but some people might not.  I have yet to meet one so I guess that 10% alcohol content thingy must have magical persuasive powers. 

Oh!  One more thing.  The caricature of Ms. Hopknocker" is based on one of Schmohz brewtap tenders.  Oh yes!  We all know who it is and if you come to Schmohz at the right time of the week, youll have no trouble recognizing her.

If you like hops in your beer; lots and lots of hops... I mean LOTS of hops, youll love this one.  Frankly, I dont like that much hops in my beer, but I assure you, that first one always tastes GREAT.  After that, it all depends on your hops tolerance.

This is another one of those beers I recommend for the "first time visitor" to Schmohz Brewerys tap room.  It looks amber.  It *IS* amber.  That being said, its the closest thing to "commercial" beer on the tap.  If youre afraid of micro-brews that are too hopped up, too malted, doctored with fruit, sugar, chocolate and other "cheater" additives, youll like Schmohz Amber Tease because it has none of that.  Just a good honest easy-drinkin brew.

OK.  Im playing favorites here with my ratings.  Its just that Ive never liked Guiness Stout.  Ive never liked ANY stout until I drank this one on a St. Patricks Day party at the brewery 2 years ago.  

This is COLD and toasty beer.  Its everything the commercial deScription says and more.  If you like stout beers, I cant guarantee youll like this one, but I sure do!
